summary: the foot-and-mouth disease virus (FMDV) is a highly contagious disease in animals. the virus belongs to the Aphthovirus genus of the Picornaviridae family. it has a single-stranded, plus-sense RNA genome that consists of 8,500 bases. the influenza A virus (IAV) M2 protein was the first protein to be studied as an ion channel. many viral proteins, including the hepatitis C virus (Vpu) p7protein, the classical swine fever virus (CSFV) p7protein, and the togavirus 6K protein, have been identified as members of the viroporin family. cornaviruses may play the same role in virus
